data.title: Richard Gardt on LinkedIn: The Golden Bullet trailer by Fly Green Alliance
data.meta_description: Thanks to a successful collaboration with FGA (Fly Green Alliance) and Sarah Wilkin I got the unique opportunity to produce a mini-documentary about‚Ä¶
data.text:
"The ability to do something positive for the business, that's also positive for the world around us is a really exciting opportunity" Diana Birkett Rakow, SVP Public Affairs and Sustainability at Alaska Airlines, discusses the company's ambitious goal of achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2040, why its important to invest in future technologies, and how their partnership with ZeroAvia is important to this vision. We're excited to grow with Alaska Airlines on our shared journey towards a cleaner future for aviation. ‚úàÔ∏è #aviation #hydrogen #netzero

Get ready for this game changer SoCal! Say goodbye to traffic and hello to the skies. Archer is launching our eVTOL network as early as 2026, delivering 10-20 minute flights to key destinations including LAX, USC, SoFi Stadium, Long Beach and Orange County. üèàüë©üèºüéìüçä‚úàÔ∏è We are grateful for Governor Newsom's unwavering support in advancing clean energy and innovative transportation solutions in the Golden State. His leadership is vital to our mission for a sustainable future. ‚ÄúCalifornia is showing the world what‚Äôs possible when you embrace innovation, entrepreneurship, and clean energy to help solve your biggest challenges. Homegrown companies like Archer Aviation are pioneering the next generation of zero-emission transportation that will help California cut pollution, clean our air, and reduce traffic.‚Äù ‚Äî Governor Gavin Newsom https://lnkd.in/gAwgM8TF

üò± "Why are we flying on a propeller plane ? Is it safe ?" Such concerns are often voiced before boarding... With the advent of the jet age üõ©, there's a prevailing notion that propeller planes belong to the past However, it turns out that propeller aircraft offer significant advantages when it comes to environmental impact: ‚õΩ They fly at slower speeds, resulting in reduced fuel consumption #CO2 üõ¨ Operating at lower altitudes means they don't produce contrails, which are another contributor to climate change #nonCO2 üèî Propeller planes are capable of landing on shorter runways, making them crucial for connecting remote communities #social In a recent study part of the KPMG Ireland Aviation 2030 series, Estuaire conducted a comparison of aircraft models based on a subset of observed flight trajectories ‚û° Check the link in first comment #sustainableaviation #contrails #turboprop #comeback Shane O'Reilly Chris RB Brown
